meanings.sent1: The company remarketed their old stock to attract new customers.
meanings.sent2: After improving the packaging, they remarketed the product to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: The clever salesman remarketed the same item as a 'limited edition' to boost interest.
meanings.sent4: She remarketed her skills in a new light, showcasing them in a different way.
meanings.sent5: The team remarketed the event with colorful banners and catchy slogans.

meanings.sent1: They remarketed the refurbished phones at a discounted price.
meanings.sent2: The store remarketed the popular toy after restocking it.
meanings.sent3: The shop owner remarketed the unsold items as 'vintage treasures'.
meanings.sent4: He remarketed his old car with a fresh coat of paint and new tires.
meanings.sent5: The online seller remarketed the items with attractive photos and detailed descriptions.

meanings.definition: The act of marketing a product again.
meanings.sent1: The remarketed of the product led to increased brand awareness.
meanings.sent2: The remarketed of the software was a success, reaching a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The remarketed of the antique collection brought in many curious buyers.
meanings.sent4: Her remarketed of the event was so creative, it drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent5: The remarketed of the book included a new cover design and promotional campaign.
